text: Carlton Dequan Weekly-Williams (December 6, 1993 – August 4, 2020), known professionally as FBG Duck, was an American rapper, songwriter and gangster, and was affiliated with the Gangster Disciples. One of the biggest in the Chicago drill, Williams had ongoing conflicts with Black Disciples. Duck released his debut mixtape Look At Me in 2013, at the age of 19. Duck would began releasing mixtapes and singles until his breakout hit single "Slide" in 2017. On August 4, 2020, Williams would be fatally shot in a Chicago’s Gold Coast neighborhood. == External links == * == References == Category:1993 births Category:2020 deaths Category:21st-century African-American musicians Category:21st-century American musicians Category:21st-century American rappers Category:21st-century African-American singers Category:African- American rappers Category:African-American singer-songwriters Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American rappers Category:American drill musicians Category:Gang members Category:Gangsta rappers Category:Midwest hip-hop musicians Category:Murdered African-American people Category:Rappers from Illinois Category:Songwriters from Illinois Category:Rappers from Chicago Category:Singers from Chicago Category:Singers from Illinois Category:American trap musicians Category:2020 murders in the United States
title: FBG Duck
